page.title: 03The Village of Brent Knoll
page.content: Brent Knoll village is based on ribbon development. It has one long main street and only a few small side roads. The main street runs north around the bottom of the Knoll from the north to the west. The houses are a mixture of old and new. One house has a date on it 1688 and the latest were built this year. Houses from all centuries make up the rest. The church of St. Michael's is built on the slopes of the Knoll in the centre of the village and the village appears to have grown around it. The school, built in 1861, is also in the middle. There is no industry in the village and farming is the main business. The north end of the village has several farms.
